title: Islamabad becomes first city with 50% fully vaccinated population
content:
ISLAMABAD, Sep 12 (APP):Minister for Planning, Development and Special Initiatives Asad Umar Sunday said Islamabad had become the first city in Pakistan to have at least 50% of its eligible population (15 years & older) fully vaccinated against COVID.
In a tweet, Asad Umar who is also head of National Command and Operation Center (NCOC) said 71% of Islamabad eligible population has received at least one dose.
He also stressed the need to accelerate process of vaccination in other cities.
